Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2014 07:56AM Jayaytea wrote: Beesie, that was a great reply.  I too had UNX and implant reconstruction.  I did ask at the SECOND consult with the surgeon about having BMX and he said there is absolutely no reason for a double. My only risk factors were my sex and my age.  Although I have had moments of uncertainty, at this point I'm glad that I at least have one breast that has feeling and that feels normal.  I am very small breasted and some people joked that I should get "two for the price of one" or asked if I love my new boob!  While I'm still a work in progress (7 mos since implant and 1 month since fat grafting ) I am satisfied with the way things have gone so far.  I can't even believe I'm saying those words. I never thought I'd be satisfied with anything about this mess. Amazing how time lets you accept things. Good luck with your journey, ladies,  I've come to love this site.
Posts.Title: UMX w/TE, very concerned about symmetry Monis Monis

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2014 08:00AM Jayaytea wrote: P.S.  I don't appreciate other people finding humor in my situation. But I can sometimes crack a joke about it myself!  Crazy emotions.
Posts.Title: UMX w/TE, very concerned about symmetry Monis Monis

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2013 10:00AM Jayaytea wrote: I had a surgery for fat grafting 10 days ago.  Since my UMX in February this year, I have been diligent about using the opposite arm for blood pressure, taking blood, etc.  I was Shocked when the anesthetist for this recent surgery told me the "latest studies" no longer indicate that this is necessary!  For my comfort, she did switch arms for the IV, but I had the blood pressure cuff put on my left arm during surgery.  By the way, my arm is bothering me on the MX side now!
Posts.Title: Lymphedema concern? Should I be concerned? wallan carol57
